name: Private Pilot License (PPL)
description: A comprehensive course designed to help aspiring pilots obtain their private pilot license, allowing them to fly non-commercial aircraft.

name: Commercial Pilot License (CPL)
description: Advanced training focused on preparing students for a career in commercial aviation, with an emphasis on professional skills and safety.

name: Instrument Rating (IR)
description: Provides pilots with the skills to fly aircraft in low visibility conditions using instruments for navigation and control.
requirements: PPL or CPL, 50 cross-country flight hours

name: Multi-Engine Rating (MER)
description: A specialized course for pilots seeking to operate aircraft with more than one engine, focusing on handling multi-engine planes.

name: Certified Flight Instructor (CFI)
description: A training program designed to prepare experienced pilots to teach and mentor future aviators, providing certification as a flight instructor.

name: Night Rating
description: Training designed to enable pilots to fly safely at night, covering night-specific flight techniques and safety protocols.

name: Airline Transport Pilot License (ATPL)
description: The highest level of certification for pilots, focused on preparing students for airline operations and leadership positions.

name: Mountain Flying Course
description: Specialized training for flying in mountainous terrain, focusing on navigation, altitude control, and dealing with weather conditions.
